Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2011 07:29AM cherylmi wrote: Thanks a million your post helped me alot more than anything at this point.... I am hoping for the best but keep reliving my brother dieing at 16 of cancer and how hopeless his situation became.  I need to focus on positive and things will be OK.  I cannot believe people have to wait over a month.....I feel for them and pray mine never goes to that stage or I may be needing psych help by then instead!!!!   I am going to just let this go for now and try to stay busy while waiting.  THANKS
Posts.Title: Waiting....biopsy results 8 days + cherylmi Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2011 02:12PM cherylmi wrote: I recieved my results today..... good news that not invasive cancer, diagnosed as ATYPICAL LOBULAR HYPERPLASIA with associated calcifications.  Got the call from my local physician and told did not have much time to check on what this is!!! I told her I had some knowledge of it and would like a MRI scheduled of both breasts due to strong family history and knowledge of dense breasts being a risk factor for hidden tumors.  Scheduled MRI per my request for next week.  NO suggestion of lumpectomy or such by MD... Thinking I should maybe see breast specialist at Mayos to follow through after MRI as have read on here as tamoxifen and lumpectomy to remove area and find borders is helpful???? Any suggestions.... really do not want to wait around for cancer to arrive would like to stay PROactive as I can.  I actually am feeling much relief just knowing it is not IBC ( pending MRI results however) my breasts are dense with many lumps and fibrogladular tissue. Glad she ordered the MRI just with my suggestion even if she did not know what ALH was :)  Thanks everyone for your well wishes.... will keep using this forum great info from real people who care about their health!!!!
Posts.Title: Waiting....biopsy results 8 days + cherylmi Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2011 06:32AM cherylmi wrote: OH my biopsy was stereotactic if that means anything different or not....for results

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2011 09:20AM cherylmi wrote: Thanks everyone for your good words and support.... I am looking at this WAITING period differently now as feeling if it was a definite invasive cancer they most likely would have got the results right away so I could go on to the next step be lumpectomy or whatever.  Before I was feeling IT IS BAD and felt little hope as it did not just come back B9 within 48 hours.  Hoping for one of the diagnosis that are increasing risk of cancer such as ADH.  But ready to take on what comes and stay POSITIVE.  Enough crying and not eating..... that is getting me no where!!!! It is all about positive and productive from here on.  THANKS everyone will post my results whenever I receive.  10 days wait now so hopefully will have this week!!!!
Posts.Title: Waiting....biopsy results 8 days + cherylmi Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2011 03:18PM cherylmi wrote: @Lisa1962 thanks for checking in on me.... no results yet.... doctors office called hospital done at and sent to Mayos said one or two more weeks....... on a stereotactic biopsy..... YIKES.... praying that they are just trying to decide between something like precancer contions versus DCIS to see if warrants lumpectomy rather than go further as they are all about save the tahtahs you know..... I just want to take it off if there is any chance of cancer........my two cousins died in there 40's of cancer and I am not ready for that path.  @packjen I did check and they are pending second opinion pathology at Mayos.... am hoping it is not invasive cancer and just having a hard time deciding if some type of precancer versus dcis or such.  I shall keep waiting.....can't believe I am having to wait about 3 to 4 weeks YIKES :)
Posts.Title: Waiting....biopsy results 8 days + cherylmi Lisa1962

Posts.Content: cherylmi wrote: I recently had a mammogram that showed a cluster of calcifications left upper outer quad with increase in interval since last year.  Underwent breast biopsy 8 days ago and no results yet.... Called path dept where biopsy sent and was told it was sent out and results would be back in one to two weeks..... When I had my MD call for a verbal on the results last week they said atypical proliferal  changes..... no definite cancer yet.... could be a couple of cancers or nothing..... should the send out make me feel more optimistic or scare me like it is???? ANyone else have this long time to wait..... hoping that they just want to double check result to be double safe as had two cousins (on my fathers side) die in their late 40's from breast cancer and I am 46. This waiting is the worst.... I cannot hardly eat ..... all I want to do is cry or sleep :( THANKS Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting....biopsy results 8 days + cherylmi Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2011 07:35PM cherylmi wrote: OK I have ADL any suggestions, most likely both breasts only had one biopsied but have clusters of micorcals in both (past two years)..... also fibrogladular tissue with 45% dense breasts. I am going to Mayos this month and am wondering if they will remove more tissue as ADL was picked up in a stereotactic biopsy of micorcals.  However I do know there are more micorcals in there as only removed area with 5. MRI next week to look for further problems.  Strong family history cancer 90% fathers side every aunt and uncle with cancer and two cousins died in 40's of breast and one aunt had breast bilateral mastectomies in 40's.  No sisters to compare to for me or my mother. Wondering if I should wait around or be proactive and have Mayos go the full yard!!!!

So going to be proactive and catch it as they stated at Mayos the cells can lead DCIS and invasive over time if left.  Any others with this and needing treatment???

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2011 06:55PM cherylmi wrote: Thanks for the info bdavis and sorry about your cancer diagnosis..... I do not know what my result will be yet but if I do have the same as you 12 years ago am wondering how long they checked your status.... yearly mammo or such.... I have multiple microcals in both breasts but just the one group was clustering. I am wondering which route to take if I do end up with the increased risk added to my current risks of 100% cancer on my fathers side.  Two cousins died in their late 40's from breast cancer and my aunt had bilateral mastectomies in her 40's for cancer. My brother died at 16 of embryonical carcinoma. And my father has one brother with prostate, one with throat, sister died of stomach and mother died of stomach, sister died of leukemia and my father has had precancerous colon polyps removed. I have read through medical journals that the fathers side counts as much as the mothers even though some say not. Well guess I will have to wait my results to decide.  This waiting is the worst.  WIll be about three to three and half weeks before I get the result.  Thinking if it was invasive breast cancer they were suspecting they would have had me on the next step already. Thinking they are having a hard time deciding where to categorize me WHO KNOWS!!!! Well best of luck with your treatment and I may do the elective MX if need be.
